Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ إِذَا وَعَدَ وَفَى وَإِذَا تَوَعَّدَ عَفَى
enWisdom: When the noble-minded person promises [something], he keeps his promise and when he threatens [to punish], he forgives
Fulfilling the promise [one makes] is one of the two emancipations
The promise [that is made] is one of the two bondages
Fulfilling promises is from the signs of distinction
The best honesty is fulfilling your promises
The most honourable of endeavours is being careful of [fulfilling] one’s pledges

Wisdom: أَحْسَنُ الصِّدْقِ الْوَفَاءُ بِالْعَهْدِ وَأَفْضَلُ الْجُودِ بَذْلُ الْجُهْدِ
enWisdom: The best honesty is fulfilling your promise and the best generosity is exerting yourself [in helping others]
Verily fulfilling promises is part of faith

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعُهُودَ قَلَائِدُ فِي الْأَعْنَاقِ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ فَمَنْ وَصَلَهَا وَصَلَهُ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ نَقَضَهَا خَذَلَهُ اللَّهُ وَمَنِ اسْتَخَفَّ بِهَا خَاصَمَتْهُ إِلَى الَّذِي أَكَّدَهَا وَأَخَذَ خَلْقَهُ بِحِفْظِهَا
enWisdom: Indeed promises are [like] metal collars around the necks [of people] until the Day of Resurrection, so whoever fulfils them is delivered by Allah, and whoever breaks them is forsaken by Allah, and whoever takes them lightly, they will take their plea to the One who has enjoined them and has ordered His creation to fulfil them

Wisdom: إِنْ وَقَعَتْ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ عَدُوِّكَ قِصَّةٌ عَقَدْتَ بِهَا صُلْحاً وَأَلْبَسْتَهُ بِهَا ذِمَّةً فَحُطْ عَهْدَكَ بِالْوَفَاءِ وَارْعَ ذِمَّتَكَ بِالْأَمَانَةِ وَاجْعَلْ نَفْسَكَ جُنَّةً بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ مَا أَعْطَيْتَ مِنْ عَهْدِكَ
enWisdom: If something happens between you and your enemy, which leads you to a truce and the enacting of a peace treaty, then preserve your pact with loyalty and guard your pledge with trust, and make your soul a shield between you and that which you have pledged
When you make a promise, keep it

Wisdom: حُطْ عَهْدَكَ بِالْوَفَاءِ يَحْسُنْ لَكَ الْجَزَاءُ
enWisdom: Guard your promise with loyalty and your reward will be good

Wisdom: خُلُوصُ الْوُدِّ وَالْوَفَاءُ بِالْوَعْدِ مِنْ حُسْنِ الْعَهْدِ
enWisdom: Sincere friendship and fulfilling promises are from loyalty to [one’s] pledge
The adornment of [all] traits is being careful [in fulfilling] the sureties
Keeping promises is the practice of the honourable ones
Be a keeper of promises and a fulfiller of vows
One who safeguards his covenant is considered loyal

Wisdom: مَنْ وَفَى بِعَهْدِهِ أَعْرَبَ عَنْ كَرَمِهِ
enWisdom: One who fulfils his promise demonstrates his nobility
Fulfilling one’s obligations [and pacts] is part of nobleness
The best trust that can be kept is fulfilling [one’s] obligations
One of the most honourable of traits is safeguarding [and fulfilling] your pledges
The best of endeavours is fulfilling one’s promise
One of the signs of faith is fulfilling promises

Wisdom: مِنَ الْمُرُوءَةِ أَنْ تَقْتَصِدَ فَلَا تُسْرِفَ وَتَعِدَ فَلَا تُخْلِفَ
enWisdom: It is part of magnanimity for you to be moderate and not extravagant, and to keep the promises you make
One of the most honourable of traits is being faithful to your pledges
From the best [teachings] of Islam is the fulfilling of pledges
The basis of a promise is its fulfilment
The promise of an honourable person is immediate and swift
Fulfilling [one’s] pledges is the adornment of honour

Wisdom: لَا تَضْمَنْ مَا لَا تَقْدِرُ عَلَى الْوَفَاءِ بِهِ
enWisdom: Do not guarantee that which you are incapable of fulfilling

Wisdom: لَا تَعِدْ بِمَا تَعْجَزُ عَنِ الْوَفَاءِ بِهِ
enWisdom: Do not promise that which you are incapable of fulfilling

Wisdom: لَا تَغْدِرَنَّ بِعَهْدِكَ وَلَا تَخْفِرَنَّ [تُحَقِّرَنَ‏] ذِمَّتَكَ وَلَا تَخْتَلْ عَدُوَّكَ فَقَدْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَهْدَهُ وَذِمَّتَهُ أَمْناً لَهُ
enWisdom: Do not renege on your covenant and do not break your pledge; and do not double-cross your enemy, for Allah has made his covenant and his pact a safety for him

Wisdom: لَا عَهْدَ لِمَنْ لَا وَفَاءَ لَهُ
enWisdom: One who has no loyalty cannot keep a promise
